ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500ml stock , made by mixing 1 tbsp bouillon powder and boiling water in a jug"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp sunflower oil"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , sliced"},{"ingredients":"thumb-sized piece  ginger , sliced"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp ground coriander"},{"ingredients":"3cm/1in piece fresh turmeric root, peeled and grated, or 1/2 tsp ground turmeric"},{"ingredients":"pinch of pink Himalayan salt"},{"ingredients":"200g courgettes , roughly sliced"},{"ingredients":"85g broccoli"},{"ingredients":"100g kale , chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 lime , zested and juiced"},{"ingredients":"small pack parsley , roughly chopped, reserving a few whole leaves to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the oil in a deep pan, add the garlic, ginger, coriander, turmeric and salt, fry on a medium heat for 2 mins, then add 3 tbsp water to give a bit more moisture to the spices."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the courgettes, making sure you mix well to coat the slices in all the spices, and continue cooking for 3 mins. Add 400ml stock and leave to simmer for 3 mins."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Add the broccoli, kale and lime juice with the rest of the stock. Leave to cook again for another 3-4 mins until all the vegetables are soft."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Take off the heat and add the chopped parsley. Pour everything into a blender and blend on high speed until smooth. It will be a beautiful green with bits of dark speckled through (which is the kale). Garnish with lime zest and parsley."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1-1.25kg/2lb 4oz-2lb 12oz ripe  tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"1 medium onion"},{"ingredients":"1 small carrot"},{"ingredients":"1 celery  stick"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 squirts of tomato purée (about 2 tsp)"},{"ingredients":"a good pinch of sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"1.2 litres/ 2 pints hot vegetable stock (made with boiling water and 4 rounded tsp bouillon powder or 2 stock cubes)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Firstly, prepare your vegetables. You need 1-1.25kg/2lb 4oz-2lb 12oz ripe tomatoes. If the tomatoes are on their vines, pull them off. The green stalky bits should come off at the same time, but if they don't, just pull or twist them off afterwards. Throw the vines and green bits away and wash the tomatoes. Now cut each tomato into quarters and slice off any hard cores (they don't soften during cooking and you'd get hard bits in the soup at the end). Peel 1 medium onion and 1 small carrot and chop them into small pieces. Chop 1 celery stick roughly the same size."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Spoon 2 tbsp olive oil into a large heavy-based pan and heat it over a low heat. Hold your hand over the pan until you can feel the heat rising from the oil, then tip in the onion, carrot and celery and mix them together with a wooden spoon. Still with the heat low, cook the vegetables until they're soft and faintly coloured. This should take about 10 minutes and you should stir them two or three times so they cook evenly and don’t stick to the bottom of the pan."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Holding the tube over the pan, squirt in about 2 tsp of tomato purée, then stir it around so it turns the vegetables red. Shoot the tomatoes in off the chopping board, sprinkle in a good pinch of sugar and grind in a little black pepper. Tear 2 bay leaves into a few pieces and throw them into the pan. Stir to mix everything together, put the lid on the pan and let the tomatoes stew over a low heat for 10 minutes until they shrink down in the pan and their juices flow nicely. From time to time, give the pan a good shake – this will keep everything well mixed."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Slowly pour in the 1.2 litres/ 2 pints of hot stock (made with boiling water and 4 rounded tsp bouillon powder or 2 stock cubes), stirring at the same time to mix it with the vegetables. Turn up the heat as high as it will go and wait until everything is bubbling, then turn the heat down to low again and put the lid back on the pan. Cook gently for 25 minutes, stirring a couple of times. At the end of cooking the tomatoes will have broken down and be very slushy looking."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Remove the pan from the heat, take the lid off and stand back for a few seconds or so while the steam escapes, then fish out the pieces of bay leaf and throw them away. Ladle the soup into your blender until it’s about three-quarters full, fit the lid on tightly and turn the machine on full. Blitz until the soup’s smooth (stop the machine and lift the lid to check after about 30 seconds), then pour the puréed soup into a large bowl. Repeat with the soup that’s left in the pan. (The soup may now be frozen for up to 3 months. Defrost before reheating.)"},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Pour the puréed soup back into the pan and reheat it over a medium heat for a few minutes, stirring occasionally until you can see bubbles breaking gently on the surface. Taste a spoonful and add a pinch or two of salt if you think the soup needs it, plus more pepper and sugar if you like. If the colour’s not a deep enough red for you, plop in another teaspoon of tomato purée and stir until it dissolves. Ladle into bowls and serve. Or sieve and serve chilled with some cream swirled in. For other serving suggestions, see opposite."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tsp rapeseed oil"},{"ingredients":"1 large onion, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 red pepper, cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves, chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp mild chilli powder"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground coriander"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground cumin"},{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"400g can black beans"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp vegetable bouillon powder"},{"ingredients":"1 small avocado"},{"ingredients":"handful chopped coriander"},{"ingredients":"1 lime, juiced"},{"ingredients":"½  red chilli, deseeded and finely chopped (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a medium pan, add the onion (reserving 1 tbsp to make the guacamole later) and pepper and fry, stirring frequently, for 10 mins. Stir in the garlic and spices, then tip in the tomatoes and beans with their liquid, half a can of water and the bouillon powder. Simmer, covered, for 15 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, peel and de-stone the avocado and tip into a bowl, add the remaining onion, coriander and lime juice with a little chilli (if using) and mash well. Ladle the soup into two bowls, top with the guacamole and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g pack mussel  in creamy sauce  (find these in the chilled aisle)"},{"ingredients":"1l strong, hot fish stock  (we used Knorr Touch of Taste concentrate)"},{"ingredients":"500g floury potato , cut into sugarcube-size pieces"},{"ingredients":"200g mixed fish"},{"ingredients":"small bunch flatleaf parsley"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Drain the sauce from the mussels into a large saucepan and add the stock. Tip in the potatoes, cover and bring to the boil. Once boiling, take off the lid and simmer for about 12 mins or until the potatoes are very tender."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, cut the fish into large chunks and roughly chop the parsley. Stir the fish and mussels into the soup, then bring back to a simmer for about 3 mins or until the fish has changed colour and flakes easily. Stir in most of the parsley, then serve scattered with the rest of the parsley and eat with crusty bread."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1-2 tbsp rapeseed oil"},{"ingredients":"2 large onions , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"4 garlic cloves , chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp turmeric"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp cumin"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"2 red chillies , deseeded and sliced"},{"ingredients":"500g carton passata"},{"ingredients":"1.7l reduced-salt vegetable bouillon"},{"ingredients":"175dried green lentils"},{"ingredients":"2 carrots , chopped into small pieces"},{"ingredients":"1 sweet potato , peeled and diced"},{"ingredients":"5 celery sticks , chopped into small pieces"},{"ingredients":"⅔ small pack coriander , few sprigs reserved, the rest chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon , cut into 4 wedges, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large non-stick sauté pan over a medium heat and fry the onions and garlic until starting to soften. Tip in the spices and chilli, stir briefly, then pour in the passata and stock. Add the lentils, carrots, sweet potato and celery, and bring to the boil."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cover the pan and leave to simmer for 30 mins, then cook uncovered for a further 5-10 mins until the vegetables and lentils are tender. Stir in the chopped coriander and serve in bowls with lemon wedges for squeezing over, and the reserved coriander sprinkled over."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp butter"},{"ingredients":"2 small  leeks , sliced"},{"ingredients":"800g carrots , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp  clear  honey"},{"ingredients":"small pinch dried  chilli flakes  (optional)"},{"ingredients":"1  bay leaf"},{"ingredients":"2 ½l vegetable  stock"},{"ingredients":"soured cream or  yogurt , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Melt the butter in a large saucepan over a medium heat. Add the leeks to the pan, then cook for 3 mins until starting to soften. Add the carrots, honey, chilli (if using) and bay leaf, then cook for 2 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in the stock, bring to the boil, then simmer for 30 mins. Blend the soup in batches, return to a clean pan, then season to taste. When ready to serve, bring back to a simmer, then ladle into mugs. Add a swirl of soured cream or yogurt and serve with garlic bread or bacon butties."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"1 large onion , chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp finely grated fresh root ginger"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove , chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp garam masala"},{"ingredients":"850ml vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"2 large carrots , quartered lengthways and chopped"},{"ingredients":"400g can chickpea , drained"},{"ingredients":"100g green bean , chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a medium saucepan, then add the onion, ginger and garlic. Fry for 2 mins, then add the garam masala, give it 1 min more, then add the stock and carrots. Simmer for 10 mins, then add the chickpeas. Use a stick blender to whizz the soup a little. Stir in the beans and simmer for 3 mins. Pack into a flask or, if you’ve got a microwave at work, chill and heat up for lunch. Great with naan bread."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp rapeseed oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 large garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"¼ tsp hot  chilli powder"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp cumin seeds"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp medium curry powder"},{"ingredients":"160g dried brown lentils"},{"ingredients":"1.2l low-salt veg stock"},{"ingredients":"large bunch coriander"},{"ingredients":"30g unsalted cashew nuts , toasted"},{"ingredients":"2 lemons , zested and juiced"},{"ingredients":"500g spinach"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large saucepan. Add the onion and fry for 8 mins until soft and translucent. Stir in half the garlic, the chilli, cumin and curry powder and cook for 1 min more. Add the lentils and stock, then cover and simmer for 30 mins over a medium-low heat."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put the coriander, remaining oil and garlic, the cashews and lemon zest in a food processor and blitz with 1-2 tbsp water until semi-smooth. Spoon the chutney into a bowl and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Stir the spinach into the soup and cook for 5 mins, or until wilted. Tip half the soup into a blender and blitz until smooth, then return this to the pan. Stir through lemon juice to taste."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Ladle the soup into bowls and top with generous dollops of the cashew chutney."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 red onion, cut into 8 wedges"},{"ingredients":"300g carrot, cut into 2cm chunks"},{"ingredients":"300g parsnip, cut into 2cm chunks"},{"ingredients":"300g peeled butternut squash, cut into 2cm chunks"},{"ingredients":"1 small potato, cut into 2cm chunks"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp ras el hanout"},{"ingredients":"1 ½ tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1.3l hot vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"6 tbsp Greek-style yogurt and 1 tbsp finely chopped mint, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Tip all the vegetables and the garlic into a roasting tin. Sprinkle over the ras el hanout and some seasoning, drizzle over the oil and give everything a good stir. Roast for 30-35 mins, turning the vegetables over halfway, until they’re tender and starting to caramelise a little."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Transfer the roasted veg to a large saucepan, pour over the hot stock and simmer for 5 mins. Purée the soup in a food processor, or in the pan with a hand blender, until smooth, then ladle into a flask for work. If eating at home, serve with a dollop of yogurt, a scattering of mint and a grinding of black pepper."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 large onion , halved"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp  dry (fino) sherry"},{"ingredients":"1kg butternut squash  peeled, deseeded and chopped"},{"ingredients":"600ml hot  vegetable stock  (we like Marigold)"},{"ingredients":"seed bread croûtons  and flat leaf parsley"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Fry the onion in the oil for 5 mins until softened. Add the sherry and squash and sizzle for 1-2 mins. Pour in the stock, then cover and simmer for 20 mins until the squash is tender when pierced with a knife."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Whizz in a food processor until smooth. Will keep in the fridge for 2 days, or freeze for 6 weeks. When ready to eat, reheat until bubbling and serve in small portions topped with seed-bread croûtons (see above right) and a parsley sprig."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"450g raw tiger prawn  in their shells"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 large onion , chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 large fennel bulb , chopped, fronds reserved"},{"ingredients":"2 carrots , chopped"},{"ingredients":"150ml dry white wine"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp brandy"},{"ingredients":"400g can  chopped tomato"},{"ingredients":"1l fish stock"},{"ingredients":"2 generous pinches paprika"},{"ingredients":"150ml pot double cream"},{"ingredients":"8 tiger prawns , shelled, but tail tips left on (optional)"},{"ingredients":"fennel  fronds (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Shell the prawns, then fry the shells in the oil in a large pan for about 5 mins. Add the onion, fennel and carrots and cook for about 10 mins until the veg start to soften. Pour in the wine and brandy, bubble hard for about 1 min to drive off the alcohol, then add the tomatoes, stock and paprika. Cover and simmer for 30 mins. Meanwhile, chop the prawns."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Blitz the soup as finely as you can with a stick blender or food processor, then press through a sieve into a bowl. Spend a bit of time really working the mixture through the sieve as this will give the soup its velvety texture."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Tip back into a clean pan, add the prawns and cook for 10 mins, then blitz again until smooth. You can make and chill this a day ahead or freeze it for 1 month. Thaw ovenight in the fridge. To serve, gently reheat in a pan with the cream. If garnishing, cook the 8 prawns in a little butter. Spoon into small bowls and top with the prawns and snipped fennel fronds."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp rapeseed oil"},{"ingredients":"1 large onion, chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp coarsely grated ginger"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves, sliced"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp ground nutmeg"},{"ingredients":"850ml vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"500g carrot (preferably organic), sliced"},{"ingredients":"400g can cannellini beans (no need to drain)"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp almonds in their skins, cut into slivers"},{"ingredients":"sprinkle of nutmeg"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large pan, add the onion, ginger and garlic, and fry for 5 mins until starting to soften. Stir in the nutmeg and cook for 1 min more."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in the stock, add the carrots, beans and their liquid, then cover and simmer for 20-25 mins until the carrots are tender."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Scoop a third of the mixture into a bowl and blitz the remainder with a hand blender or in a food processor until smooth. Return everything to the pan and heat until bubbling. Serve topped with the almonds and nutmeg."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"300g celery, sliced, with tough strings removed"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove, peeled"},{"ingredients":"200g potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"500ml vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"100ml milk"},{"ingredients":"crusty bread, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large saucepan over a medium heat, tip in the celery, garlic and potatoes and coat in the oil. Add a splash of water and a big pinch of salt and cook, stirring regularly for 15 mins, adding a little more water if the veg begins to stick."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in the vegetable stock and bring to the boil, then turn the heat down and simmer for 20 mins further, until the potatoes are falling apart and the celery is soft. Use a stick blender to purée the soup, then pour in the milk and blitz again. Season to taste. Serve with crusty bread."}]

recipe: Mexican-style bean soup with shredded chicken & lime
name: Mexican-style bean soup with shredded chicken & lime

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2l vegetable or ham stock"},{"ingredients":"150g red lentils"},{"ingredients":"6 carrots, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 medium leeks, sliced (about 300g)"},{"ingredients":"small handful of chopped  parsley, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the stock in a large pan and add the lentils. Bring to the boil and allow the lentils to soften for a few minutes."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the carrots and leeks and season (don't add salt if you use ham stock as it will make it too salty). Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat, cover and simmer for 45-60 mins until the lentils have broken down. Scatter over the parsley and serve with buttered bread, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"3 celery sticks, chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 small carrots , chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 red onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp thyme leaves , plus extra to serve"},{"ingredients":"50g dried porcini mushrooms"},{"ingredients":"225g plum tomatoes , deseeded and chopped"},{"ingredients":"850ml chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp chopped parsley"},{"ingredients":"3 slices good crusty bread , toasted and torn into chunks"},{"ingredients":"6 eggs"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan and gently fry the celery, carrots, onion, garlic and thyme for 10-15 mins until softened. Meanwhile, cover the porcini with hot water and soak for 15 mins until softened and swollen. Drain the mushrooms, reserving the soaking liquid, and roughly chop. Add to the softened vegetables along with the soaking liquid and cook for another 5 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Stir in the tomatoes and cook for 10 mins until they begin to break down, then pour in the stock and bring to a gentle simmer."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Poach the 6 eggs in a separate large saucepan of simmering water for 3-4 mins until set, then remove with a slotted spoon. Add the parsley and a little seasoning to the soup, and mix in the torn-up toasted bread. Divide the soup between 6 bowls and place an egg on top of each. Serve scattered with extra thyme."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1l low-salt chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp Thai red curry paste"},{"ingredients":"100g flat rice noodle"},{"ingredients":"150g pack shiitake mushroom , sliced"},{"ingredients":"125g pack baby corn , sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 skinless salmon fillets , sliced"},{"ingredients":"juice 2 limes"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp reduced-salt soy sauce"},{"ingredients":"pinch brown sugar"},{"ingredients":"small bunch coriander , chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Pour the stock into a large pan, bring to the boil, then stir in the curry paste. Add the noodles and cook for 8 mins. Tip in the mushrooms and corn and cook for 2 mins more."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the salmon to the pan and cook for 3 mins or until cooked through. Remove from the heat and stir in the lime juice, soy sauce and a pinch of sugar. Ladle into 4 bowls and sprinkle over the coriander just before you serve."}]

recipe: Potato & Savoy cabbage soup with bacon
name: Potato & Savoy cabbage soup with bacon

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250g broth mix (or a mixture of 75g pearl barley, 75g yellow split peas, 50g red split lentils and 50g green split or marrowfat peas)"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp vegetable or olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 large onion, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 leek, washed and sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 medium turnip, peeled and finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 carrots, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 celery sticks, trimmed and finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 litres lamb stock"},{"ingredients":"200g kale chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Rinse the soup mix and soak in cold water for 8 hrs or overnight, covered in a cool place. Drain and rinse well."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large pan and fry the onion, leek, turnip, carrots and celery for 10 mins, covered with a lid, until soft but not golden. Add a generous pinch of salt and a good grinding of pepper."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Pour the stock into the pan and bring to a simmer. Add the drained soup mix, and gently simmer for 1 hr part-covered, until the barley and split peas are tender. Season again if needed. Stir in the kale, and cook for 10-15 mins until tender, then ladle into bowls to serve."}]

recipe: Leek & butter bean soup with crispy kale & bacon
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 tsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"500g leeks , sliced"},{"ingredients":"4 thyme sprigs , leaves picked"},{"ingredients":"2 x 400g cans butter beans"},{"ingredients":"500ml vegetable bouillon stock"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp wholegrain mustard"},{"ingredients":"½ small pack flat-leaf parsley"},{"ingredients":"3 rashers streaky bacon"},{"ingredients":"40g chopped kale , any tough stems removed"},{"ingredients":"25g hazelnuts , roughly chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large saucepan over a low heat. Add the leeks, thyme and seasoning. Cover and cook for 15 mins until softened, adding a splash of water if the leeks start to stick. Add the butter beans with the water from the cans, the stock and mustard. Bring to the boil and simmer for 3-4 mins until hot. Blend the soup in a food processor or with a stick blender, stir through the parsley and check the seasoning."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put the bacon in a large, non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Cook for 3-4 mins until crispy, then set side to cool. Add the remaining 1 tsp oil to the pan, and tip in the kale and hazelnuts. Cook for 2 mins, stirring until the kale is wilted and crisping at the edges and the hazelnuts are toasted. Cut the bacon into small pieces, then stir into the kale mixture."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Reheat the soup, adding a splash of water if it is too thick. Serve in bowls sprinkled with the bacon & kale mixture."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g potato , unpeeled and roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 vegetable stock cubes"},{"ingredients":"1kg courgettes , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"bunch spring onion , sliced - save 1 for serving, if eating straight away"},{"ingredients":"100g extra-mature cheddar or vegetarian alternative, grated, plus a little extra to serve"},{"ingredients":"good grating fresh nutmeg , plus extra to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the potatoes in a large pan with just enough water to cover them and crumble in the stock cubes. Bring to the boil, then cover and cook for 5 mins. Add the courgettes, put the lid back on and cook for 5 mins more. Throw in the spring onions, cover and cook for a final 5 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Take off the heat, then stir in the cheese and season with the nutmeg, salt and pepper. Whizz to a thick soup, adding more hot water until you get the consistency you like. Serve scattered with extra grated cheddar, spring onions and nutmeg or pepper. Or cool and freeze in freezer bags or containers with good lids for up to 3 months."}]

recipe: Gazpacho with runner bean tempura & pickled coriander seeds
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"25ml white wine vinegar"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp sherry vinegar"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp coriander seeds"},{"ingredients":"1kg tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"200g cucumber , peeled and deseeded"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp capers"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves"},{"ingredients":"1 red chilli , deseeded"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1-2 tbsp sherry vinegar"},{"ingredients":"150ml vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"100g runner beans , stringed, cut in half, then sliced lengthways (discarding tough beans from inside)"},{"ingredients":"90g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp cumin seeds"},{"ingredients":"½ egg , beaten"},{"ingredients":"200ml ice-cold sparkling water"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"To make the pickled coriander seeds, put the vinegars in a small pan with the sugar and 25ml water. Bring to the boil, drop in the coriander seeds, turn off the heat and leave to infuse."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"To peel the tomatoes, lightly score a cross in the top of each one, place in a large bowl and cover with boiling water for 1 min. Drain and peel. Cut each one into quarters and use a knife to scrape away the seeds. Don’t discard what you remove – sieve out the seeds and use the juice in the next step."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Blitz the tomatoes, cucumber, capers, garlic, chilli and 2 tsp sea salt in a food processor. Pour into a bowl and chill for a couple of hours for the flavours to meld, then add the olive oil and stir. Add 1 tbsp of the sherry vinegar and taste. If it needs more to bring out the flavours, then add another tbsp. Divide between bowls and chill the soup while you make the runner bean tempura."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Pour the vegetable oil into a high-sided saucepan and set over a medium heat to get up to temperature (about 180C) while you make the batter."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"To make the batter, put the flour, a pinch of salt and the cumin seeds in a bowl and stir. Add the beaten egg, then pour in the water. Gently stir the mixture, taking care not to over-mix it – a few lumps help give tempura its texture. Test the temperature of the oil by dropping in a little bit of batter. It should bubble and float to the top. If it browns immediately, reduce the heat."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Mix the runner beans into the batter and then fry in batches, removing with a slotted spoon once they’re crisp, golden and just starting to brown. Drain on kitchen paper and season. Top each bowl of soup with some crispy runner beans, and spoon over a little of the drained, pickled coriander seeds."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1l hot chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp Thai red curry paste"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp Thai fish sauce"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp sugar"},{"ingredients":"zest and juice 2 limes"},{"ingredients":"100g Portobello mushrooms, sliced"},{"ingredients":"bunch spring onions, sliced, whites and greens seperated"},{"ingredients":"200g leftover chicken, shredded"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Tip the stock into a saucepan, then stir in the curry paste, fish sauce, sugar, lime juice and most of the zest. Bring to the boil, then add the mushrooms and whites of the spring onion. Cover, then simmer for 2 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Stir in the chicken and most of the spring onion greens to gently heat through, then serve ladled into bowls and scattered with the remaining lime zest. Serve with extra lime juice, sugar and fish sauce on the side so everyone can adjust their own bowlfuls."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 onion , chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1-2 tbsp Thai red curry paste"},{"ingredients":"300g red lentil"},{"ingredients":"1.7l vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"200ml coconut milk"},{"ingredients":"chopped spring onions , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Fry the onion in 1 tbsp olive oil until soft. Stir in the red Thai curry paste, depending how hot you want it."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add red lentils and mix to coat in the paste. Pour over vegetable stock and simmer for 20 mins until the lentils are tender."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Blend with coconut milk and reheat if needed. Serve scattered with chopped spring onions, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 green pepper , diced"},{"ingredients":"200g sweetcorn , frozen or from a can"},{"ingredients":"1-2 tbsp chipotle paste (we used Discovery)"},{"ingredients":"250g Pouch ready-cooked long-grain and wild rice mix (we used Uncle Ben's)"},{"ingredients":"400g can black beans in water, rinsed and drained"},{"ingredients":"1.3l low-sodium chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"2 cooked skinless chicken breasts , shredded"},{"ingredients":"small bunch coriander , chopped"},{"ingredients":"low-fat soured cream and reduced fat guacamole, to serve, if you like"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan and cook the onion for 5 mins. Throw in the pepper and cook for 2 mins more, then add the sweetcorn, chipotle paste and rice. Stir well and cook for 1-2 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the black beans and the stock. Bring to the boil, turn down to a simmer, then add half the chicken and coriander. Cool for 2-3 mins, then ladle into bowls."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Scatter over the rest of the chicken and coriander. Serve with a dollop each of guacamole and soured cream on top if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tsp rapeseed or coconut oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp grated ginger"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"1 sweet potato (about 200g), peeled and cut into 2cm cubes"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp turmeric"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp ground cumin"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp medium or hot curry powder"},{"ingredients":"400g can chickpeas, rinsed"},{"ingredients":"150ml low-fat coconut milk"},{"ingredients":"500ml vegetable stock (see tip, below)"},{"ingredients":"160g kale, chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 lime, juiced"},{"ingredients":"1 red chilli, finely chopped (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large pan and fry the onion for 5 mins. Add the ginger and garlic, fry for 1 min more, then stir in the sweet potato, spices and chickpeas. Cook for another 5 mins, adding a little water if the spices stick to the pan."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in the coconut milk and 400ml of the stock, then bring to a simmer and cook for 8 mins. Season, then transfer a quarter of the soup to a blender and whizz until smooth. Pour in the reserved stock to loosen, if needed, then add back to the pan with the remaining soup. Stir in the kale and cook for 5 mins. Add the lime juice, then ladle into bowls and scatter over the chilli, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 white onion, finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"3 garlic cloves, sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 carrots, scrubbed and diced"},{"ingredients":"85g red lentils"},{"ingredients":"1 vegetable stock cube, crumbled"},{"ingredients":"generous sprigs parsley, chopped (about 2 tbsp) plus a few extra leaves"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the kettle on to boil while you finely slice the onion. Heat the oil in a medium pan, add the onion and fry for 2 mins while you slice the garlic and dice the carrots. Add them to the pan, and cook briefly over the heat."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in 1 litre of the boiling water from the kettle, stir in the lentils and stock cube, then cover the pan and cook over a medium heat for 15 mins until the lentils are tender. Take off the heat and stir in the parsley. Ladle into bowls, and scatter with extra parsley leaves, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , chopped"},{"ingredients":"1kg courgettes , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp dried mint"},{"ingredients":"1.3l vegetable stock (try Marigold vegetable bouillon powder)"},{"ingredients":"3-4 sprigs of fresh mint"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp single cream"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large saucepan, add the onion and cook gently for about 2-3 minutes until softened. Now add the courgettes and dried mint, and stir well to mix with the onion. Cover and cook over a gentle heat for about 10 minutes until the courgettes are softened but not coloured."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in the stock and bring to the boil, then lower the heat to a gentle simmer. Strip the mint leaves off the stalks and drop them into the pan, then cover the pan and continue simmering gently for 20 minutes or until the courgettes are very tender. Remove from the heat and let the bubbles subside before blitzing in a food processor or blender until smooth (if you like a really smooth soup, simply pour it through a sieve after blitzing). Pour into a bowl and leave to cool, then cover and chill for at least 4 hours (or overnight)."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"To serve, taste and season with salt and pepper. Serve in chilled soup plates with a spoonful of cream drizzled in the middle."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 tbsp rice vinegar or white wine vinegar"},{"ingredients":"500ml chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp soy sauce"},{"ingredients":"1-2 tbsp golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"thumb-size piece ginger , peeled and thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 small hot red chillies , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"3 spring onions , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"300g small raw peeled prawns , from a sustainable source"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the vinegar, stock, soy sauce, sugar (start with 1 tbsp and add the second at the end if you want the soup sweeter), ginger, chillies and spring onions in a saucepan and bring to a simmer. Cook for 1 min, then add the prawns to heat through. Serve in small bowls or cups."}]

recipe: Supergreen soup with yogurt & pine nuts
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"1 potato (approx 250g), cut into small cubes"},{"ingredients":"600ml vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"120g bag mixed watercress, rocket and spinach salad"},{"ingredients":"150g pot  natural yogurt"},{"ingredients":"20g pine nuts , toasted"},{"ingredients":"chilli oil , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over a low-medium heat. Add the onion and a pinch of salt, then cook slowly, stirring occasionally, for 10 mins until softened but not coloured. Add the garlic and cook for 1 min more."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Tip in the potato followed by the veg stock. Simmer for 10-12 mins until the potato is soft enough that a cutlery knife will slide in easily. Add the bag of salad and let it wilt for 1 min, then blitz the soup in a blender until it’s completely smooth."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Serve with a dollop of yogurt, some toasted pine nuts and a drizzle of chilli oil, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp unsalted butter"},{"ingredients":"1 medium  onion"},{"ingredients":"400g medium  potatoes  (about 2), peeled and cut into 1cm cubes"},{"ingredients":"250g smoked haddock"},{"ingredients":"250ml whole milk"},{"ingredients":"½ small bunch of parsley or chives, finely chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Melt the butter in a saucepan over a medium heat, then add the onion and fry for 5-8 mins until translucent but not browned. Add the potatoes and 300ml water and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat slightly and simmer for 10-15 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, put the haddock in another pan and cover with the the milk. Cook gently for 5 mins, or until just tender. Remove the haddock from the milk with a slotted spoon (reserving the milk), transfer to a plate and leave to cool slightly. When cool enough to touch, flake into large pieces, removing any bones."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Put the reserved milk and flaked haddock in the pan with the potato mixture and cook for another 5 mins. Season and sprinkle over the parsley to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"small bunch thyme"},{"ingredients":"2 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 fat garlic clove, chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 celeriac (about 1kg), peeled and chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 potato (about 200g), chopped"},{"ingredients":"1l veg stock (check the label to ensure it’s vegan – we used Marigold)"},{"ingredients":"100ml soya cream"},{"ingredients":"50g blanched hazelnuts, toasted and roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp truffle oil, plus an extra drizzle to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"In a large saucepan, heat the oil over a low heat. Tie the thyme sprigs and bay leaves together with a piece of string and add them to the pan with the onion and a pinch of salt. Cook for about 10 mins until softened but not coloured."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 min more, then tip in the celeriac and potato. Give everything a good stir and season with a big pinch of salt and white pepper. Pour in the stock, bring to the boil, then simmer for around 30 mins until the vegetables are completely soft."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Discard the herbs, then stir through the cream, remove from the heat and blitz until completely smooth. Stir through 1/2 tbsp truffle oil at a time and taste for seasoning – the strength of the oil will vary, so it’s better to start with less oil and add a little at a time."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"To serve, reheat the soup until piping hot, then ladle into bowls and top with the hazelnuts, some black pepper and an extra drizzle of truffle oil."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 large onion, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove, crushed"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp mild chilli powder"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp ground cumin"},{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"500ml vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"400g can mixed beans, drained and rinsed"},{"ingredients":"1 red pepper, cut into chunky dice"},{"ingredients":"tortilla chips, to serve"},{"ingredients":"4 limes wedges, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a deep saucepan and fry the chopped onion over a medium heat until tender. Add the garlic and tomato purée, stirring for 1-2 mins until combined. Sprinkle in the spices and cook for another 1 min."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Tip in the chopped tomatoes, half fill the can with water, and add to the pan. Pour in the stock and simmer on a medium heat for 10-15 mins, uncovered. Season, then whizz using a hand blender until smooth. Add the beans and red pepper, and cook for another 15 mins until the pepper is tender."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Serve in bowls topped with a small pile of tortilla chips and a lime wedge."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tsp rapeseed oil"},{"ingredients":"small bunch spring onions , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 cucumber , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 large round lettuce , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"225g frozen peas"},{"ingredients":"4 tsp vegetable bouillon"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp bio yogurt (optional)"},{"ingredients":"4 slices rye bread"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Boil 1.4 litres water in a kettle. Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan and cook the spring onions for 5 mins, stirring frequently, or until softened. Add the cucumber, lettuce and peas, then pour in the boiled water. Stir in the bouillon, cover and simmer for 10 mins or until the vegetables are soft but still bright green."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Blitz the mixture with a hand blender until smooth. Serve hot or cold, topped with yogurt (if you like), with rye bread alongside."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp rapeseed oil"},{"ingredients":"1 large onion, chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 carrots, chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 celery sticks, chopped"},{"ingredients":"50g dried red lentils"},{"ingredients":"1½ l boiling vegetable bouillon (we used Marigold)"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp chopped fresh thyme"},{"ingredients":"1 leek, finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"175g bite-sized cauliflower florets"},{"ingredients":"1 courgette, chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 garlic cloves, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"½ large Savoy cabbage, stalks removed and leaves chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp basil, chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large pan with a lid. Add the onion, carrots and celery and fry for 10 mins, stirring from time to time until they are starting to colour a little around the edges. Stir in the lentils and cook for 1 min more."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in the hot bouillon, add the tomato purée and thyme and stir well. Add the leek, cauliflower, courgette, and garlic, bring to the boil, then cover and leave to simmer for 15 mins."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Add the cabbage and basil and cook for 5 mins more until the veg is just tender. Season with pepper, ladle into bowls and serve. Will keep in the fridge for a couple of days. Freezes well. Thaw, then reheat in a pan until piping hot."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomato"},{"ingredients":"110g pack of  chorizo  sausage (unsliced)"},{"ingredients":"140g wedge Savoy cabbage"},{"ingredients":"sprinkling dried chilli flakes"},{"ingredients":"410g can chickpea , drained and rinsed"},{"ingredients":"1 chicken or vegetable stock  cube"},{"ingredients":"crusty bread or garlic  bread, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put a medium pan on the heat and tip in the tomatoes, followed by a can of water. While the tomatoes are heating, quickly chop the chorizo into chunky pieces (removing any skin) and shred the cabbage."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pile the chorizo and cabbage into the pan with the chilli flakes and chickpeas, then crumble in the stock cube. Stir well, cover and leave to bubble over a high heat for 6 mins or until the cabbage is just tender. Ladle into bowls and eat with crusty or garlic bread."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive or  rapeseed oil"},{"ingredients":"2 onions , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 dessert apples , peeled and finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 celery sticks, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"½ small  butternut squash , peeled, seeds removed, chopped into small pieces"},{"ingredients":"2-3 heaped tbsp gluten-free curry powder (depending on how spicy you like it)"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp ground cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp nigella seeds (also called black onion or kalonji seeds)"},{"ingredients":"2 x 400g cans chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"1 ½l gluten-free chicken or vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"140g basmati rice"},{"ingredients":"small pack  parsley , chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp mango chutney , plus a little to serve, if you like (optional)"},{"ingredients":"natural yogurt , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in your largest saucepan. Add the onions, apples and celery with a pinch of salt. Cook for 10 mins, stirring now and then, until softened. Add the butternut squash, curry powder, cinnamon, nigella seeds and a grind of black pepper. Cook for 2 mins more, then stir in the tomatoes and stock. Cover with a lid and simmer for 15 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"By now the vegetables should be tender but not mushy. Stir in the rice, pop the lid back on and simmer for another 12 mins until the rice is cooked through. Taste and add more seasoning if needed. Stir through the parsley and mango chutney, then serve in bowls with yogurt and extra mango chutney on top, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 meaty chicken carcass, plus any jellified roasting juices from it, skin and fat discarded"},{"ingredients":"1 large onion , halved and sliced"},{"ingredients":"zest and juice 1 lemon"},{"ingredients":"2 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"1-2 red chillies , halved, deseeded and sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground coriander"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp ground cumin"},{"ingredients":"small pack coriander , stems and leaves chopped and separated"},{"ingredients":"1 large garlic clove , finely grated"},{"ingredients":"250g pouch wholegrain basmati rice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Break the chicken carcass into a large pan and add the onion, 1.5 litres of water, the lemon juice and bay leaves. Cover and simmer for 40 mins. Remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly, to make things a bit easier to handle."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Place a colander over a bowl and scoop out all the bones into the colander. Pick through them, stripping off the chicken and returning it with any onion as you work your way down the pile of bones."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Return any broth from the bowl to the pan – and any jellified roasting juices – along with the chilli, ground coriander, cumin, coriander stems, lemon zest and garlic. Cook for a few mins until just bubbling – don’t overboil as you will spoil the delicate flavours. Taste, and season only if you need to. Meanwhile, heat the rice following pack instructions, then toss with the coriander leaves. Ladle the broth into bowls and top with the rice."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 large cauliflower (1.5kg), cut into florets"},{"ingredients":"½ tbsp ground cumin"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil , plus extra for drizzling"},{"ingredients":"4 thyme sprigs"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 celery stick, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove , crushed"},{"ingredients":"750-850ml veg or chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"100ml single cream"},{"ingredients":"½ small bunch of parsley , finely chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7. Toss the cauliflower florets in a roasting tin with 1 tbsp olive oil, the cumin and the thyme. Roast for 15 mins or until golden and tender. Discard the thyme."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the remaining oil in a saucepan with the onion and celery and fry over a medium heat for 10 mins or until softened. Add the garlic and cook for 1 min. Stir through most of the cauliflower, reserving some to top the soup with later. Add 750ml of the stock to the pan and bring to a simmer. Cook for 10 mins."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Blitz the soup until smooth using a hand blender or food processor. Stir through the cream and season to taste. Add extra stock if you like your soup a little thinner. Ladle into bowls and top with the parsley, reserved cauliflower and an extra drizzle of olive oil."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp rapeseed oil"},{"ingredients":"2 large onions , halved and thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"20g dried porcini mushrooms"},{"ingredients":"3 tsp vegetable bouillon powder"},{"ingredients":"300g chestnut mushrooms , chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 garlic cloves , finely grated"},{"ingredients":"300g potato , finely diced"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp fresh thyme"},{"ingredients":"4 carrots , finely diced"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp chopped parsley"},{"ingredients":"8 tbsp bio yogurt"},{"ingredients":"55g walnut pieces"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large pan. Tip in the onions and fry for 10 mins until golden. Meanwhile, pour 1.2 litres boiling water over the dried mushrooms and stir in the bouillon."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the fresh mushrooms and garlic to the pan with the potatoes, thyme and carrots, and continue to fry until the mushrooms soften and start to brown."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Pour in the dried mushrooms and stock, cover the pan and leave to simmer for 20 mins. ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tsp cumin seeds"},{"ingredients":"large pinch chilli flakes"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 red onion, chopped"},{"ingredients":"140g red split lentils"},{"ingredients":"850ml vegetable stock or water"},{"ingredients":"400g can tomatoes, whole or chopped"},{"ingredients":"200g can chickpeas or ½ a can, drained and rinsed (freeze leftovers)"},{"ingredients":"small bunch coriander, roughly chopped (save a few leaves, to serve)"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp 0% Greek yogurt, to serve"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp cumin seeds"},{"ingredients":"large pinch chilli flakes"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 red onion, chopped"},{"ingredients":"140g red split lentils"},{"ingredients":"850ml vegetable stock or water"},{"ingredients":"400g can tomatoes, whole or chopped"},{"ingredients":"200g can chickpeas or ½ a can, drained and rinsed (freeze leftovers)"},{"ingredients":"small bunch coriander, roughly chopped (save a few leaves, to serve)"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp 0% Greek yogurt, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat a large saucepan and dry-fry 2 tsp cumin seeds and a large pinch of chilli flakes for 1 min, or until they start to jump around the pan and release their aromas."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add 1 tbsp olive oil and 1 chopped red onion, and cook for 5 mins."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Stir in 140g red split lentils, 850ml vegetable stock or water and a 400g can tomatoes, then bring to the boil. Simmer for 15 mins until the lentils have softened."},{"method":"STEP 9"},{"method":"Whizz the soup with a stick blender or in a food processor until it is a rough purée, pour back into the pan and add a 200g can drained and rinsed chickpeas."},{"method":"STEP 10"},{"method":"Heat gently, season well and stir in a small bunch of chopped coriander, reserving a few leaves to serve. Finish with 4 tbsp 0% Greek yogurt and extra coriander leaves."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"knob of butter"},{"ingredients":"1 large onion, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 large cauliflower (about 900g/2lb), leaves trimmed and cut into florets"},{"ingredients":"1 potato, peeled and cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"700ml vegetable stock (from a cube is fine)"},{"ingredients":"400ml milk"},{"ingredients":"100g mature cheddar, diced"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the butter in a large saucepan. Tip in the onion and cook until softened, about 5 mins, stirring often. Add the cauliflower, potato, stock, milk and seasoning. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat and leave to simmer for about 30 mins until the cauliflower is soft and the potato almost collapsing."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Whizz in a food processor or crush with a potato masher until you get a creamy, thick soup. Top up with more milk to thin a little if serving in mugs. You can make ahead up to 2 days in advance, cool, cover and leave in the fridge until needed, or freeze for up to 1 month. When ready to serve, warm through, ladle into mugs or bowls, top with the cheese pieces, then stir through before eating."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp butter or olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"5 soft sun-dried or SunBlush tomatoes in oil, roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 x 400g cans plum tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"500ml turkey or vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp sugar, any type, or more to taste"},{"ingredients":"142ml pot soured cream"},{"ingredients":"125g pot fresh basil pesto"},{"ingredients":"basil leaves, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the butter or oil in a large pan, then add the garlic and soften for a few mins over a low heat. Add the sun-dried or SunBlush tomatoes, canned tomatoes, stock, sugar and seasoning, then bring to a simmer. Let the soup bubble for 10 mins until the tomatoes have broken down a little."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Whizz with a stick blender, adding half the pot of soured cream as you go. Taste and adjust the seasoning – add more sugar if you need to. Serve in bowls with 1 tbsp or so of the pesto swirled on top, a little more soured cream and scatter with basil leaves."}]

recipe: Potato & Savoy cabbage soup with bacon
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 onion"},{"ingredients":"1 carrot"},{"ingredients":"1 celery stick"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil, plus extra to serve"},{"ingredients":"550g floury potatoes, peeled and cut into small cubes"},{"ingredients":"1l chicken or vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"8 rashers streaky bacon"},{"ingredients":"a quarter medium Savoy cabbage (about 200g/8oz)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Chop the onion, carrot, celery and garlic in a food processor. Heat the oil over a medium heat in a large saucepan. Add the vegetables and potatoes, season well, then reduce the heat and cover the pan. Gently cook for about 5 mins until starting to soften, then add the stock, turn up the heat and bring to the boil. Simmer for 5 mins more, or until all the vegetables are tender."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"While the soup is cooking, grill or fry the bacon until crisp, then cut into strips. Shred the cabbage, discarding the core."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Whizz the soup in the food processor until smooth, then return to the pan and add the cabbage. Simmer for a few mins until the cabbage is just tender, then season to taste and serve scattered with the bacon."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1.5kg  pumpkin or squash, peeled and roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"4 tsp sunflower oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp grated ginger"},{"ingredients":"1 lemongrass, bashed a little"},{"ingredients":"3-4 tbsp  Thai red curry paste"},{"ingredients":"400ml can  coconut milk"},{"ingredients":"850ml vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"lime juice and sugar, for seasoning"},{"ingredients":"1 red chilli, sliced, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Toss the pumpkin or squash in a roasting tin with half the oil and seasoning, then roast for 30 mins until golden and tender."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, put the remaining oil in a pan with the onion, ginger and lemongrass. Bring to a simmer, cook for 5 mins, then fish out the lemongrass. Cool for a few mins, then whizz until smooth with a hand blender, or in a large blender in batches. Return to the pan to heat through, seasoning with salt, pepper, lime juice and sugar, if it needs it. Serve drizzled with the remaining coconut milk and scattered with chilli, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"100g smoked bacon lardons"},{"ingredients":"1 red onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 carrot , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 celery stick , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"2 thyme sprigs"},{"ingredients":"300g celeriac (or any other root veg), cut into cubes"},{"ingredients":"200g potato , cut into cubes"},{"ingredients":"400g can borlotti beans , drained and rinsed"},{"ingredients":"1 ½l chicken stock or turkey stock, (fresh is best)"},{"ingredients":"350g cooked turkey"},{"ingredients":"100g orzo"},{"ingredients":"75g curly kale , shredded"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat 1 tsp of oil in a large saucepan. Add the bacon and fry over a medium-to-high heat for 4-5 mins or until golden, then set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put the remaining oil, the onion, carrot, celery and a pinch of salt in the pan. Cook gently over a low heat for 8-10 mins, stirring occasionally, until the veg is soft but not coloured. Add the garlic and herbs, and cook for 2 mins more"},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Tip in the celeriac, potato, borlotti beans and chicken stock. Bring to the boil, then simmer, uncovered, for 10-15 mins. Add the cooked turkey, orzo and the bacon, and cook for 10 mins."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Just before serving, tip in the kale, give everything a good stir and return to the heat for about 2 mins or until the kale has wilted."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp sunflower oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"500g pack skinless chicken thigh fillets, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"4 garlic cloves , finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"285g jar Thai green curry paste"},{"ingredients":"400ml can coconut milk"},{"ingredients":"1 ¾l chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"5 kaffir lime leaves"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp fish sauce"},{"ingredients":"1 bunch spring onions , the white sliced on the diagonal and the green finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"280g pack fine green bean , trimmed and halved"},{"ingredients":"150g pack bamboo shoot"},{"ingredients":"juice 2 limes , plus wedges to serve"},{"ingredients":"small bunch basil"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in your largest pan, add the onion and fry for 3 mins to soften. Add the chicken and garlic, and cook until the chicken changes colour."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the curry paste, coconut milk, stock, lime leaves and fish sauce, then simmer for 12 mins. Add the chopped onion tops, green beans and bamboo shoots and cook for 4-6 mins, until the beans are just tender."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Meanwhile, put the lime juice and basil in a narrow jug and blitz with a hand blender to make a smooth green paste. Pour into the soup with the sliced spring onion and heat through. Serve with lime wedges for a light lunch or supper or as a make-ahead starter."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 onions, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"¼ tsp hot chilli powder"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp ras el hanout"},{"ingredients":"1 butternut squash, peeled and cut into 2cm pieces"},{"ingredients":"100g red lentils"},{"ingredients":"1l hot vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"1 small bunch coriander, leaves chopped, plus extra to serve"},{"ingredients":"dukkah (see tip) and natural yogurt, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large flameproof casserole dish or saucepan over a medium-high heat. ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 leek, green top left whole, white finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"small bunch fresh thyme"},{"ingredients":"3 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"bunch parsley, stalks whole, leaves roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 strips of orange peel"},{"ingredients":"1 mild red chilli"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 onions, chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 leek"},{"ingredients":"1 fennel, fronds picked and reserved, fennel chopped"},{"ingredients":"4 garlic cloves, minced"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"1 star anise"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp Pernod, optional, if you have it"},{"ingredients":"4 large, ripe tomatoes, chopped"},{"ingredients":"large pinch (⅓ tsp)  saffron strands"},{"ingredients":"1 ½l fish stock"},{"ingredients":"100g potato, one peeled piece"},{"ingredients":"1kg of filleted mixed Mediterranean fish, each fillet cut into large chunks. (We used a mix of red and grey mullet, monkfish, John Dory and gurnard)"},{"ingredients":"300g mussels, optional"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves"},{"ingredients":"1 small chunk of red chilli (optional)"},{"ingredients":"small pinch saffron"},{"ingredients":"1 piece of potato, cooked in the broth, (see above)"},{"ingredients":"1 egg yolk"},{"ingredients":"100ml olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp lemon juice"},{"ingredients":"½ baguette, thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"To make the croutons heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Lay the slices of bread on a flat baking tray in a single layer, drizzle with olive oil and bake for 15 mins until golden and crisp. Set aside – can be made a day ahead and kept in an airtight container."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Use a layer of the green part of the leek to wrap around and make a herb bundle with the thyme, bay, parsley stalks, orange peel and chilli. Tie everything together with kitchen string and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a very large casserole dish or stock pot and throw in the onion, sliced leek and fennel and cook for about 10 mins until softened. Stir through the garlic and cook for 2 mins more, then add the herb bundle, tomato purée, star anise, Pernod if using, chopped tomatoes and saffron. Simmer and stir for a minute or two then pour over the fish stock. Season with salt and pepper, bring to a simmer, then add the piece of potato. Bubble everything gently for 30 mins until you have a thin tomatoey soup. When that piece of potato is on the brink of collapse, fish it out and set aside to make the rouille."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"While the broth is simmering make the rouille by crushing the garlic, chilli and saffron with a pinch of salt in a mortar with a pestle. Mash in the cooked potato to make a sticky paste then whisk in the egg yolk and, very gradually, the olive oil until you make a mayonnaise-like sauce. Stir in the lemon juice and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Once the chunky tomato broth has cooked you have two options: for a rustic bouillabaisse, simply poach your fish in it along with the mussels, if you're using (just until they open) and serve. For a refined version, remove the herb bundle and star anise. Using a handheld or table-top blender, blitz the soup until smooth. Pass the soup through a sieve into a large, clean pan and bring to a gentle simmer. Starting with the densest fish, add the chunks to the broth and cook for 1 min before adding the next type. With the fish we used, the order was: monkfish, John Dory, grey mullet, snapper. When all the fish is in, scatter over the mussels, if using, and simmer everything for about 5 mins until just cooked and the mussels have opened."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Use a slotted spoon to carefully scoop the fish and mussels out onto a warmed serving platter, moisten with just a little broth and scatter over the chopped parsley. Whichever way you choose the rouille is there to be stirred into the broth to thicken and give it a kick."}]
